column1: The presidential election in the fall of 1848 aroused a good deal of interest
column2: for Wisconsin had now become a state
column3: and citizens could vote for national candidates. I was in Jonathan Piper's store one evening
column5: when about a dozen men were present. A political discussion sprang up and grew hot
column6: and finally a division was called for. Two or three voted for Zachary Taylor
column7: the Whig candidate; one for Lewis Cass
column8: the Democrat; and the rest for Martin Van Buren
column9: Free Soiler. The State went with the lone voter
column10: for Cass carried it by a small plurality.Good health was the rule among the hardworking
column12: but plowing up the soil released the poison which nature seemed to have put there on guard
column13: and every one at one time or another came down with the "shakes." However
column16: and cholagogue speedily won their way
column17: and in a few years malaria had become a mere reminiscence.In November
column19: my parents moved to Beaver Dam
column20: and thus our life in the Rock River country came to an end.
